Chile: Spain recognizes the Independence of Chile
China: Wei Yuan published the Illustrated Treatise on the Maritime Kingdoms.

The Qing dynasty and the United States signed the Treaty of Wanghia, according to which the United States was granted most favoured nation (MFN) status and extraterritoriality was granted to its citizens resident in China.
Cuba: Known as the Year of the Lash, when an uprising of black slaves was brutally suppressed.
Haiti: The Dominican Republic declares its independence from Haiti
The Piquets, peasants of southern Haiti led by Jean-Jacques Acaau, revolt against the government
The Piquets force Riviere-Hérard into exile; Philippe Guerrier is appointed President of Haiti
Philippine: Narciso Clavería y Zaldúa appointed Governor-General (1844–1849)
Singapore: The Tan Tock Seng Hospital begins operation.
USA: U.S. presidential election, 1844: An election is held.
